front.div:
Abstract.
DLNA is a leading standard for consumer electronics devices. But it does not enable
remote devices to connect to services in the home, using the IMS-based networks now
being rolled out by telecom companies. We present a solution for interworking DLNA
and IMS, and discuss the implications. We also describe how to enable IMS services
on DLNA devices.
